title: (x) Bug with
content: I always preview before I post, and I think I discovered another bug. Even if a link is broken, it still previews blue, thus giving a false impression that it's coded correctly.
author: Chris Dean

comments.content: If the "a" tag comes through, poor CSS can't do anything but colour it blue.

The syntax for `A` (anchor) is ``_your anchor content_``. Not all anchors are hyperlinks, though. You can turn an anchor into a hyperlink by adding the `href` attribute; full syntax then is ``_your anchor content_``.
Yeah, it's just the way html works. It's not a Typophile bug.
if you find any links that need fixing, please contact me and i can fix them.
Mark is incorrect. `a:link` matches hypertext links only in CSS and can thus differentiate `A HREF` from `A ID`. It’s a question of CSS, not HTML, and no, it isn’t true that nothing can be done.
